DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Weight at Time of Procedure Unit of Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure for the weight of an individual at the time of a procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Weight at Time of Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._The weight of an individual at the time of a procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
The weight of an individual at the time of a procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/10/19 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for Medical History CRF.  6-18-19 tt created for CPTAC Medical History CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

Concepts.definition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 8-14-19 tt associated concept with EVS definition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.

Concepts.definition: The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
